properties.popup-text:
Fountain of the Godsmongers
This fountain sits at the center of six shrines to the six disciples of Caltolav known as the Godsmongers.
Trade Plaza

The Little Market
A collection of small booths and display areas available for rent by the day, week or month for asporint tradespersons or crafters to display their wares.

The Peddlers’ Palliate
Owned by Alain Mudslinger
Beacon of Lev Venix
Park of the Golden Dawn

Athear of Justice
Dedicated to Szalavalar (Map location B.7)

Abyssal Claw
The location of the Abyssal Claw that was used by Mezrek during the Abyssal Rending to invade Merisyl.
Park of the Scarlet Dusk
Debberoth Mercantile Foundation

Eilendere Trade Consortium Tradehouse
This merchant house is primarily comprised of Elvish traders.
Monument to Priestess Ziernia
Plaza of the Setting Sun
Galtiere’s Cheese Factory

The Cheese Hut
Specializing in cheeses of all sorts.

Fallen Treasures
Pawn shop.  Owned and operated by Menk Tornwing
Draconic Goods Exchange
Wick It
Press and Play

The Peak
A tavern catering to Ixen

Bread Basket
Bakery

Residence
The home of Trinja Whiteice.

Kerowyn's Money Exchange
A moneychanger’s office and home.

Medelain Hall
An inn commonly used as a gathering spot for political campaigning.
Docks

Residence
The home of Terkvajkiz
Alendy’s Glade

Endless Festival
The nearby temple to Haryxmi has established these large buildings as venues for all sorts of entertainment, from music to plays to dancing and more. True to its name, it is never closed and never empty.
Celestial Park

City Council Complex
Collects taxes and tribute on behalf of the city council.

Tanns’ Tattoos
Offers tattooing

Athear of the Hopeful Dawn
Dedicated to no specific God or Goddess, but instead the concept that Death waits for all living things, and thus is a powerful force deserving of worship.

Wind Rider
Leatherworker specializing in saddles and riding gear.  Includes exotic items such as harnesses for riding dragons and rocs.

Lady Roush’s Apothecarium
Sells potions.
Flowers of the Island Trail
Scales of Trade
Exotic Merchandise Combine
Fenland Trade Association
Arcanea

Magisterium
The offices, training grounds and compound of the city magistrates.
Assassin's Guild
Mercenary Guild

Sage's Guild
A loosely-organized guild of historians, researchers and others driven by a quest of knowledge.
Thieves' Guild

Craftsman's Guild
An organization dedicated to ensuring that tradesmen are fairly treated by the merchant consortiums of the city.

Holy Fen of Vivlorean
A temple dedicated to  Vivlorean, the Korthjach Goddess of life, death, rebirth and renewal.

Athear of the Brass
A temple dedicated to Haryxmi

Athear of the Forge
A temple dedicated to Ator

Athear of the Deep
A temple dedicated to Khirr

Athear of the Bounty
A temple dedicated to Premyzic

Athear of Night
Dedicated to the dark side of human nature rather than any specific Deity, this temple celebrates hedonistic pleasures, vices and forbidden desires.  Always in conflict with the Athear of Justice and frequently in conflict with the Athear of Trade, the financial power of the Athear of Night gives them significant sway in the city.

Athear of Trade
A temple dedicated to Caltolav

Athear of the Duality
A temple dedicated to Endrell

Athear of the Ninefold
This Athear is dedicated to the concept of balance, and the importance of avoiding extremes.  Devoted primarily to philosophical musings on this topic, they tend to accumulate the least wealth – and therefore wield the least power.  Their patron Goddess is Nuvria.

Athear of Hate
A temple dedicated to Zelagiur

Temple of Humanity
This is a temple dedicated not to any deity, but to the concept that the strength and ability of non-draconic races is significant and meaningful, and should be appreciated and celebrated.   Its members are known as the Order of Humanity.

Lake Verrisima
This deligntful park is a common destination for those who seek a brief respite from the bustle of Aodar.

Tzantor's Broadsheets
Fegrin Tzantor and a small staff produce a weekly newsheet with a modest but dedicated readership.

Council Exchange
The Council Exchange is the building in which all legislative activity for the city takes place.

Tavrix Ulcha
Draconic for 'Violet Tower', this 8 story tower is the home of the mage known as 'The Father'.

Mistress Capachic's Home for Children
Mistress Capachic runs an orphanage supported by wealthy donors. She is both a skilled caretaker and a skilled fundraiser.

Cold Truth
A daily paper run by Saolo Deronda, a former member of a major merchant house. The paper is a forum for nurturing their many grudges.

Perivale's Outfittery
Sells weapons and armor.

Meyville's Tannery
Cures and tans leather for use by tailors, armorers, etc.

Thickstitched
Gon Thickstitch creates and sells finely crafted leather goods.

Cresting Wave
An upscale tavern that caters to the patrons of the nearby tournament grounds.

The Empty Boot Camp
A quiet tavern which caters primarily to Magistrates.

Children's Delight
Toymaker

Pandela's Palace of Pets
Pet shop

Plaza of the Grand Caravan
A small but well-known open-air marketplace. To attract customers they make a weekly 'parade' of their restocking from the Aodar docks, with musicians, entertainers, and candies for the children.

Dawnbreak
This inn offers a spectacular sunrise view, and one of the most highly touted breakfasts in the city.

Coral Crest
This inn/tavern is one of the most expensive in the Free City, catering to the movers and shakers of the city.

The Tippler's Top
A cozy tavern offering hearty fare, fine drinks, and tales of adventure.

Brother Camtor's
The drinks and service here are mediocre, but the outdoor seating and Brother Camtor's riveting tales keep business high.

Museum of the Winds of Trade
A tribute to the naval and trade history of Aodar, with historical artifacts from the early days of various trade houses and shipping companies.

Sensate Emperium
An expensive establishment specializing in sensory experiences. Patrons might visit to indulge in luxurious baths infused with magical oils, partake in exquisite feasts that tantalize all five senses, or even undergo enchantments that heighten their perception of the world around them. It is a place where the boundaries between reality and fantasy blur, offering an escape from the mundane into a realm of heightened sensations.

Open Crate
Adventuring supplies.

Flagon Spirits
Their sign proudly proclaims 'When ye have flagging spirits you need Flagon Spirits.'

Unshekvir (“Noble Horse”)
Unshekvir offers boarding for horses, and rental of horses.

Scriptorium
Scribing services.

The Black Unicorn
This inn caters primarily to Dwarven customers.

Bastion of Knowledge
A private library curated by a small group of wealthy retirees who call themselves the 'Liberators of Knowledge'. They strive to acquire rare or out print books, copy them, and make the copies available for loan.

Paedric's Weaving
Paedric's stands out with its colorful array of fabrics and intricate tapestries. The air is filled with the rhythmic clacking of looms, as his skilled children create masterpieces of cloth and thread, offering a glimpse into the rich tapestry of life in Aodar.

The Naked Truth
A unique combination of erotic dancing and fortune telling. By appointment only.

Park of the Crest
A delightful park behind the Tradesmen's Crest inn, a peaceful refuge for wealthy travelling merchants.

The Giving Blade
Tser Vroy's butcher shop, devoted to honoring the sacrafice made by the animal whose meat is taken.

Starshine
Silver smith.

Bright Morning
Bakery

Prismatic Arena
A venue jointly owned by a number of trading houses, available for concerts, plays, combat tournaments and more.

The Victory Cup
A tavern primarily serving the patrons of the nearby Prismatic Arena.

Fergal's Finest
The docks, offices and fishing piers of Fergal's Finest, one of the premier fisheries on the island.

Aodar Mercantile Center for Education
A school funded by the trade consortiums of Aodar

Metta the Laundress
Launderer

Aodar Players
A community theatre funded by a wealthy but mysterious donor.

Jester's Juice
A tavern and boarding house run by Jesira Terrum, aka 'Jester'.

Madam Oviovix – Speaker of Dreams
Fortune teller

Grand Yard
Elegant jousting lists overlooking the ocean. The amazing view inspires frequent sunrise matches.

Lanthwip's House Broker
Lanthwip specializes in facilitating the sale and purchase of homes.

Bartur's Wood Carvings
Elegant and life-like wood carvings by Ulare Bartur.

Plentiful Basket
Fresh fruits and vegetables.

Tower of Perault
The windows of this 100 foot tower glow with an eerie light most evenings. More myths than facts surround Fangor Perault and his mysterious tower.

Dreblin's Stables
A seedy, run-down stable badly in need of repairs.

Tack-n-Harness
Saddles, bridles and all other horse related equipment.

Coral Corner
An inn decorated in a nautical theme, renowned for its wide selection of beer.
Embassy of the Achuak Hoardland
Embassy of Aujir Homeland
Embassy of Aurix Resplendancy
Embassy of Azure Sands
Embassy of Cerulean Crescent
Embassy of Dominion of Rach
Embassy of the Duchy of Haaven
Embassy of Emerald Vale
Embassy of Frostfeld
Embassy of Obsidian Fenhold
Embassy of Ornea
Embassy of the Protectorate of the Black Wyrm
Embassy of Verthis
Embassy of Waterblade
Embassy of Charir
Prison

Hoyra's Helping Hands
Helps the underemployed find work while providing needed manual labor to the wealthy (while taking a healthy commission).

Yngrabbok's Pottery
Kiln-fired clay goods.

Cozy of the Night
A simple inn, guaranteed for a clean bed and decent meal, with no frills.

Pyril's Oaklore
Ornate decorative oaken wordwork.

Cover of Dusk
A delightful tavern on the Plaza of the Setting Sun, renowned for its creative yet affordable alcoholic creations.

Sandwiches and Meat Pies
The name says it all...

Gallery of the Gifted
A collection of booths and display areas for the artists (and those who fancy themselves talented) to display their works for purchase.

Sails and Canvas
Sales, canvas, and other ship-related goods.

Crenneleth and Sons
Shipbuilders

Timberhold Millworks
Timberhold Millworks is a bustling sawmill on the east shore of Aodar, where skilled woodcutters and craftsmen produce fine lumber and enchanted wooden artifacts. The mill is renowned for its ability to imbue wood with magical properties, creating sought-after items for adventurers and wizards alike.

Long Haul Wagons
Makes wagons, carts, cart wheels and the like.

The Ale Bringer
A cooper, the proprietor Vandy Precarious, believes that he does the world a great service by providing a means for ale to be brought from one place to another.  To celebrate his contribution he partakes heavily of ale.

Oaken Throne
Furniture maker

Gnulpund's Smithy
Blacksmith

Moser's Goldsmithing
Goldsmith

A Strong Coil
Ropemaker

Iron Anvil
This former smithy was converted to a Tavern by Suros Umvyellyn, a retired merchant who always dreamed of owning his own tavern and is wealthy enough that he's not concerned with how much money he makes. It is a popular neighborhood gathering spot, featuring live music, the star of whom is Gahzrok Furstom, a talented percussionist who uses the old iron anvil on the grounds to produce amazing rhythyms.

Sure Step
Farrier

Bezyndar's Exotics
A massive pet shop with merchandise that ranges from the commonplace to the exotic to the rare and magical. While commonfolk are welcome, and do a steady business, the opulence of the place is funded by the more esoteric requests, which Bezyndar's team of unparalled hunters will obtain.

Golden Path
Racetrack

Timrick Mason
Home of Timrick, a mason.

Bell Tower
A 12-story belltower.  The city road runs through the first two stories.

Mishka's House
Home of Mishka, daughter of an academic specializing in the study of the Pacantryx.

Ironguard
Locksmith

Brinnek Stonewall
Mason

Vorrus' Bakery
Bakery

Amaphyra's Sculptures
Studio and shop selling sculptures.

Fired Earth
Potter
Mug o' Mud

True Lye
Soap maker

Jenlyn's House
Jenlyn is a Kobold bartender at the Medelain Hall.

Home of Wharven Kelsbedder
A single-story house with a large basement, this is where Wharven Kelsbedder has made his residence. It is now dilapidated, after a number of subsequent residents suffered injuries or death. It is rumored to be cursed.

The Frisky Toad
A lively tavern in the heart of Aodar known for its spirited atmosphere, hearty fare, and lively entertainment. Step inside and join the revelry!

Bale of Ale
The shopkeeper, Kailen Tapper, has been known to sell minor poisons.

Dapper Dinlyn's
Tailor

Petrov Estate
This is the Estate of the powerful caster Alvyx Petrov.
Amber Keg

The Lucky River
Seedy tavern widely known for its high-stakes poker games. Despite the ramshackle appearance, both a lot of gold and a lot of power can be found inside on most nights.

Empo’s Pet Emporium
A quaint pet shop run by the elderly Ms. Calliope Tresser. It is named for her massive greying wolfhound Emperor (or Empo, for short). Given any opening, Calliope will regale her customers of why she never married. 'Never in my 60 years of adulthood did I find a man as brave and loyal as my Empo, so I just stuck with him the whole dang time.' Needless to say, she loves her dog.

Vem the Verminator
Wildlife removal services & pest control.

Runeskin
This tattoo parlor is a world of dark artistry, where the ink tells tales of secrets and whispers of power. The inscription above the door reads 'Dare to bear the mark of Runeskin'.

Evrum’s Bows
Bowmaker / Fletcher

Forever Friends
Taxidermy shop run by Cabzel Porlune

Earthtreasure
Purveyors of Exquisite Jewels. Discover a dazzling array of magical gemstones and expertly crafted jewelry, each piece imbued with love and care.

Arcavictorious
This spot is popular with the locals, who enjoy the tall tales told by the proprietor, Arkavix (a Tamgol) and the band of former adventurers he's attracted as regular patrons.

Trinzenivate's Isle
A soaring tower rises above this small island, joined by three slightly shorter towers sunk deep into the ocean floor. This is the home and government seat of Trinzenivate, the ancient Brass dragon who claims Aodar as his protectorate.
